actions.committee: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to amend the Truth in Lending Act with respect to extensions of credit to consumers under the age of 21.
short_title: Underage Consumer Credit Protection Act of 2001

summary.text: Underage Consumer Credit Protection Act of 2001 - Amends the Truth in Lending Act to prescribe application requirements for the issuance of a credit card to an underage (under age 21) consumer, which include: (1) signature indicating joint liability for debts in connection with the account by another individual having the means to repay debts incurred by the underage consumer; (2) submission of financial information indicating an independent means of repayment by the consumer; or (3) proof of completion by the consumer of a specified credit counseling course.Authorizes the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve system to promulgate the attendant rules and model forms.

titles.title: Underage Consumer Credit Protection Act of 2001
A bill to amend the Truth in Lending Act with respect to extensions of credit to consumers under the age of 21.
